body.p: Indiana lawyer and U.S. Army officer. Washington County, Indiana native. Graduated from Norwich University in Northfield, Vermont, in 1843 and the law department of Indiana University in 1850. Married Mary Jane Armitage May 17, 1849. Veteran of the Mexican-American War. Member of the Indiana Constitutional Convention 1849-50. Appointed judge of the 8th Judicial Circuit Court of Indiana in 1851. Captain in First Indiana Volunteers from June 20, 1846, to June 16 1847. Served in Ninth Indiana Infantry as captain from April 23, 1861 to August 27, 1861. Promoted to colonel August 27, 1861. Promoted to brigadier general on September 3, 1861 and major general on November 29, 1862. Resigned his commission July 26, 1865.
